INTEGRATED NUTRIENT AND WATER MANAGEMENT

The application of either organic or inorganic fertilizer is done to supplement what soil could not provide which will contribute to better crop productivity. A recommended fertilizer rate per hectare or per hill is followed to avoid adverse effects on the plant and soil.

Application of Organic and Inorganic Fertilizers

If soil pH is below 5.6, apply lime one month before transplanting at a rate of 3-5 tons/ha. 

 

In fertilizer application, the following is recommended:

  1. If organic fertilizer is available, incorporate 120 bags (50 kg/bag) per hectare into the soil two weeks before planting. Organic fertilizer will supplement the complete fertilizer. 

  2. If organic fertilizer is not available, apply complete fertilizer (14-14-14) at 10-15 g/hill and cover with soil after planting. 

  3. Apply urea as sidedress at 10 g/hill every two weeks during the vegetative stage. 

  4. At the start of fruiting stage, apply equal parts of 46-0-0 and 0-0-60 at 10-15 g/hill.

  5. Apply the same rate of fertilizer as number 4 if necessary depending on the crop condition.

Water Management

Irrigate the newly transplanted seedlings. The follow up irrigation is done after a week from transplanting and once a week thereafter. Irrigation is needed twice a week during the fruiting period. The frequency of irrigation will depend on the growth of the crop.
